intro: Jessenia, commonly known as the Mexican elder or Jessenia bataua, is a flowering plant native to Central America and northern South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellow or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. Jessenia is often found in moist, tropical environments and is valued for its ornamental appeal. It also has traditional uses in local medicine and as a source of fiber.
